See also: Appendix:Variations of "ol"

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German oli, from Latin oleum (“olive oil”), from Ancient Greek ἔλαιον (élaion, “olive oil”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /øːl/
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Öl n (genitive Öl or Öles, plural Öle)

  1. oil

Declension[edit]

Declension of Öl
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeindasÖldieÖle
genitiveeinesdesÖles,
Öls		derÖle
dativeeinemdemÖl,
Öle1		denÖlen
accusativeeindasÖldieÖle
1Now uncommon, see notes
